In that yesterday he suffered in the flesh from precisely this assurance that God’s mind was known, and (leaving out the long massacre written in all our religious history) does he, who is the same to—day, suffer less now in the person of his little ones? Surely if we could realise that inasmuch as we prejudge the nearness to God, the inspiration of the least— the least, not the most saintly-—of our opponents, we despise the Christ, we should see that there is some great fallacy underlying our notion of the benefit of doctrinal certainties.
